Just a reminder for eLearning Days this week that the Technology Help Desk is here to assist parents and students with technology issues. You can reach the help desk via email at elearning@tricreek.k12.in.us or by phone at 219-750-1315. Leave a message and one of our technology team members will call you back. The help desk is monitored from 8:00am until 3:30pm each day and calls made in the evening will be returned the next morning.

One of the most common calls our team gets is about not being able to get a student iPad onto the Internet after connecting to your home wireless. Please remember to click the Smoothwall app icon before going on to Google Classroom or any other app. This has to be done each morning you do eLearning or else your device will not be able to connect. Call or email the help desk if you continue to have issues getting connected.

The following message was sent this morning to all Tri-Creek parents by Dr. Gardin:

Good morning. This is Dr. Gardin, and we do have school today. The reason for my call is to dispel a rumor that we learned of last night. The rumor was that a middle school student had a gun at school on Wednesday. The rumor is false.

After learning of the rumor, Lowell and Lake County Police were notified and our director of safety and security worked through the night to review video footage and interview students who alleged they saw something black in a student’s hand. The video footage showed that the item was a cell phone.

While we want staff and students to say something if they see something, that needs to be done immediately so the matter can be promptly investigated and accurately to avoid false accusations and worry.

Please know that we work hard every day to keep everyone safe. If you ever have concerns, please report them promptly to your child’s principal.

Thank you.

Today all Tri-Creek School Corporation schools will begin utilizing the SafeVisitor visitor management system to increase safety and security at our buildings. Upon entry to the building visitors will be asked to produce identification that will be scanned to check against national sex offender registries and local exclusion lists to ensure that there is not a security threat. Acceptable forms of identification include a driver’s license, state ID card, military ID, or a passport. Visitors will be issued a badge to be worn throughout the building and must be checked out by the office when exiting the building.

If you have any questions about the SafeVistor program or about specific types of identification needed please contact our Director of Safety and Security Carl Porter at cporter@tricreek.k12.in.us.

PRESS RELEASE
January 22, 2018

Student safety is of paramount importance to Tri-Creek School Corporation. To ensure safety, Lowell High School held an evacuation drill today, January 22, 2018 at 8:41 a.m. A Canine Drug Search of the parking lot, classrooms and lockers began at 8:55 a.m. while students were in the fieldhouse for the evacuation drill. As part of the evacuation drill, backpacks were left in the classrooms. The dogs gave two positive alerts at which point those areas were searched in the presence of the property owner, administration and police. Marijuana and marijuana by-products were found. Administration is currently collaborating with the police in dealing with the positive alerts. Students did an outstanding job of cooperating during the evacuation and search. We greatly appreciate the support from the county canine unit and area police departments. Follow up to these positive alerts are being conducted by the Lowell Police Department.

Jordan Jusevitch's National Letter of Intent Signing will take place this Wednesday.

Jordan finished his prep career as Lowell High School's all-time leading tackler, playing in 53 varsity games (also a LHS record). He is a 2x IFCA Top 50 Player, an IFD Prime Time 25, 2x Post and Times Defensive Player of the year. Team MVP and Captain. Jordan's career at Lowell High School includes a 43-11 record, 2 NCC Championships, 4 Sectional, 2 Regional and 1 Semi State Championship.

Jordan will be signing to continue his education and playing career for Coach Tom Allen and the Indiana Hoosiers. We offer him our sincere congratulations and wish him the best as he begins a collegiate career.

Dr. Debra Howe , Superintendent of Tri-Creek School Corporation, announced her retirement at the Board meeting on December 14, 2017. Please read the attached article posted on NWIndiana Life to learn more.

Dr. Howe stated: "The faculty and staff at Tri-Creek are the greatest strength of the district and I know that they will continue to move the district forward, to nurture the youth in our community, and to engage students in meaningful education as life-long learners. They continually focus on our students and on growing a collaborative and respectful education community with each other and for the students. Knowing that the district is heading in a positive direction with people, processes, and plans in place that work towards continual improvement, I am ready to pursue a new journey in my life where I can spend more time with my family and to continue service as a community leader in different ways.”
